column4: How do I restore/fix X window from the terminal when i am unable to startx ?
you can try "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" or you can use "sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf" to edit the file manually
if you know how to use emacs (and have it installed) or vim, you can use those instead of nano, but nano has the lowest learning curve
well, as long as you know that ^ means you press Ctrl with the letter and that "Write Out" means "Save"
